title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
The U.K. government is starting a national-security review of Nvidia's $40 billion deal to buy Arm from SoftBank, raising a new hurdle for the proposal.

---

A cryptocurrency that was created as a joke exploded into plain view on Wall Street, with a surge in dogecoin sending its 2021 return above 8,100%.

---

Credit Suisse said two executives in charge of its prime brokerage unit will leave in the wake of the bank's $4.7 billion loss from the collapse of Archegos.

---

Musk's internet satellite venture has spawned an unlikely alliance of rivals, regulators and experts who cite risks from the project.

---

U.S. safety officials are investigating a fatal crash involving a Tesla vehicle.

---

Apple said in a letter to lawmakers that it plans to make Parler available through its App Store again.

---

U.S. stocks fell, with the Nasdaq, S&P 500 and Dow retreating 1%, 0.5% and 0.4%, respectively.

---

IBM posted higher revenue for the first quarter, ahead of a landmark split of the business this year.

---

The union that unsuccessfully sought to organize an Amazon location in Alabama has filed challenges over the vote.

---

GameStop said CEO George Sherman will step down by July 31.

---

Coca-Cola said its sales volume in March returned to pre-pandemic levels.
